intro: Relbunium hirtum f. minor, commonly known as the lesser hairy bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, compact growth habit. The plant features small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
